attributes.action: Allow the Court of Protection to give elderly persons with diagnosed dementia a hearing on their capacity to ensure they are not being abused for gain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Elderly Persons with medically recorded dementia are not currently protected against decisions they make which is not necessarily in their own best interest. These decisions should be the responsibility of the Court of Protection to determine capacity, and that "institutionalised ageism" reveals the "Golden Rule", which is to ensure capacity has been broken time and time again. 
If a lawyer or doctor has to observe these rules, then so should the state, ie, the general registry office.
